LanguageData.GoldenEye.label: golden eye
LanguageData.GoldenEye.description: An eye prosthesis made out of gold. An exorbitant way to cover up a missing eye.
LanguageData.LightReceptor.label: light receptor
LanguageData.LightReceptor.description: An eye prosthesis. The optic nerves recieve stimulation from the light sensors and signal processors, creating a sensation of vision. It's not as good as a natural eye, but it's a lot better than being blind.
LanguageData.SimpleSpine.label: replacement spine
LanguageData.SimpleSpine.description: A spine prosthesis. Highly advanced for its time, can be considered as an early bionic prototype with the first sophisticated application of neural interface in a prosthesis. Still, it is inferior to a real spine
LanguageData.SimpleProstheticHand.label: prosthetic hand
LanguageData.SimpleProstheticHand.description: A hand prosthesis. While it lacks a neural interface, its complex arrangement of internal joints allows it to mimic natural movement quite convincingly. Still, it is inferior to a real hand.
LanguageData.SimpleProstheticFoot.label: prosthetic foot
LanguageData.SimpleProstheticFoot.description: A foot prosthesis. While it lacks a neural interface, its complex arrangement of internal joints allows it to mimic natural movement quite convincingly. Still, it is inferior to a real foot.
LanguageData.SimpleProstheticFinger.label: prosthetic finger
LanguageData.SimpleProstheticFinger.description: Archaic and crude replacement for lost fingers. Not terribly efficient and certainly not comfortable, but gets the job done.
LanguageData.SimpleProstheticToe.label: prosthetic toe
LanguageData.SimpleProstheticToe.description: Archaic and crude replacement for lost toes. Inefficient and uncomfortable, they generate a lot of noise while walking, but they get the job done.
LanguageData.HydraulicJaw.label: hydraulic jaw
LanguageData.HydraulicJaw.description: A jaw prosthesis. While it lacks a neural interface, its complex arrangement of internal joints allows it to mimic natural movement quite convincingly. Food is crushed and chewed more efficiently, but the finer details of speaking is slightly lacking.
LanguageData.ArtificialNose.label: artificial nose
LanguageData.ArtificialNose.description: A nose prosthesis. Used to cover where the missing nose was on the face.
LanguageData.ReplacementRadius.label: replacement radius
LanguageData.ReplacementRadius.description: A replacement for the radius, a bone in the lower arm.
LanguageData.EPIA_ScytherBlade.label: scyther blade
LanguageData.EPIA_ScytherBlade.description: Weaponized hand implant utilizing a telescoping blade. Scavenged and restored from a dead scyther mechanoid. Not very comfortable, but quite effective as a close-range weapon.
